ratings.comment: Professor Paker is one of a kind. His lectures are hand written on the board, but engaging. The textbook is just a supplement, not required but definitely helpful. Tests are based on lectures with reasonable questions. But above all, he is one of the nicest professors who genuinely cares for his students. Take his class if given the opportunity.
This professor penalizes his student for following directions. Do not, under any circumstances, take him as a professor.

I like Prof Paker a lot. He does write exclusively on the whiteboard, but he also uploaded his notes (~35 pages/chapter) for us to refer to. Your grade is exclusively exams, but he posted old exams on Canvas for practice. Very fair grader and very good at explaining material.

Sweet, caring, awesome lecturer, but sometimes hard to hear/understand. Uses a chalk board but in the best way possible-doesn't post the lecture content, so go to lecture. Flexible with exams if you let him know right away. Super knowledgeable, tough content, but doesn't try to trick you. He wants you to succeed.

One of the sweetest professors, he always brightened my day. Material on exams is heavily based off of lectures, it's very important to pay attention in class since he doesn't use any technology or slides (just writes everything on the chalkboard as he goes)

Class is entirely exam based, all hand written lectures. If you put in the work it will pay off, practice exams are just like the real exam and he is very accessible and you can tell he really cares. Sweetest prof ever, great class.
Really Nice Guy. Has reasonable expectations.

If you're taking this as a FIN elective, I would look elsewhere unless you're dying to understand complex foreign exchange concepts and international investment risks (adv macro econ +1). If you want to work in a treasury department for a F500 and you're expected to manage currency risk, this class will prepare you well.

Bulent is an old-school guy and only writes on the blackboard, so if you skip class you are out of luck. Not the most interesting guy to listen to but his exams are pretty similar to past ones which he gives you to study from and the curve is generous.

Bulent is literally adorable. He cares a lot about his students and their overall well being and understanding of course material. His exams are hard, but the curve is fair. Expect his exams to be a bit harder than the practice, but very very similar in format and questions. He's definitely a seasoned lecturer and exams are lecture heavy.

Both his 325 and 320 classes will involve a lot of handwritten notes. Chalkboard lectures are thorough, easy to follow, and contain a lot of practical information for both in and outside of class. Professor Paker ranks near the top for my favorite WSB prof for caring so much about helping students to learn finance and stay intellectually curious
Very old school, writes notes on the blackboard every class. 100% graded off of exams. Since he doesn't post anything online the only way to know the material is by going to lecture.

Favorite professor I've had at UW-Madison. I personally love the chalkboard writing because you can keep up with his pace vs. slides. Finance 300 is very hard, but he explains the concepts clearly and provides a lot of practice problems.

The best professor I have ever had. He explains concepts very clearly and the lectures are organized. Definitely attend lecture because the exams are largely based on it. Also super helpful office hours.

Very traditional teaching style. Teaches entirely off his notes and on the chalkboard, but the lectures were very well organized. His exams are focused primarily on class material, but he would toss on random terms from the textbook so make sure to review those. Attend class, no notes online to catch if you miss. Grade completely based on 3 exams.

Hi guys, I see comments here talking about him using only chalkboard as the main complain. That is fine, but usually only the best, most dedicated professor do that. If you ever take professor David Johnson, econ class, you would notice that he use only chalkboard also. Professor Bulent is an amazing lecturer with amazing dedication to his class

Bulent. Where do I begin. This man is the best. Lays out everything you need in a transparent way. Practice tests will prepare you for the tests, and you can pretty much predict what will make it on the exam from lecture. Friendly guy, good lecturer, and a hell of a friend.

I thoroughly enjoyed Bulent. Yes, his classes mostly entail chalkboard writing, but his pace and consistency made content easier to understand (in comparison to other classes). The exams are mostly centered around class notes, and the book is useful for terms. There was a heavier emphasis on statistics, but his exam problems were useful.

Bulent is a great professor and great person. Although he only uses chalkboard and handwritten notes, he teaches a very tough class in an understandable way. Most importantly, he is a genuinely nice guy. I recommend him.

Great Professor. Although he only uses chalkboard and talks very quietly, his lectures are very thorough with plenty of examples. He is humorous at times, and clearly cares about his students learning Finance. Would highly recommend taking Bulent for Finance 320.

This guy is one of my least favorite professors in my entire time here at UW. Walking into his classroom is like stepping 50 years in the past. He uses zero technology whatsoever. He tests you on little details and does not explain things well.

Not a hard professor, just painfully boring and awful. It's 2017 and he's still using ONLY a chalkboard. Talks to himself for half of the class while scribbling on the chalkboard and for the other half he tries to give life advice instead of teaching finance. Really condescending, weirdest guy I've met. Honestly, not sure he's still here
If you have to take Fin300, he is the best professor.  He gave many examples.  He also was very clear with what was going to be on the test.

I took Finance 300 during the summer. The class is fast-paced and you must attend lecture and read a lot to succeed. I highly recommend taking the class in the summer because the professor has a great way of helping students grasp difficult concepts. The only grades in the class were a midterm and a final, so stay away if you're a bad tester.

Do not take for Finance 320.  Nice guy and all.  But boring lecturer---all chalkboard; no use of slides/technology/excel, etc.  No application -- just memorization of equations.  75 minutes of chalkboard writing every class.

Bulent is a wonderful instructor who is truly an academic. Most business profs are bored ex-business professionals who cannot teach, but Bulent knows how to lead a student to understanding. If he is teaching Fin300 during the summer, do everything you can to take it with him instead of during the regular semester!
Awesome guy, cares about his student. You can find the textbook free online if you google it.

Best professor I've had. He was able to explain concepts clearly that i had never full grasped before. He seems to really care and want his students succeed and understand. Wonderful lecturer, mixed gentle humor with true understanding of material.

I had him for 325 and International Finance, and this semester gave up not having class on a few days just to switch into his section for 320. He explains ideas with remarkable clarity, makes funny jokes once in a while, and is very genuine. Grade is based on 3 tests which are very fair and test your knowledge of his lecture notes. Quantitative.
One of my favorite professors! He is soooooo kind and explain everything clearly. Strongly recommend his class.

You must attend lecutre to do well, but he is an excellent professor. Goes through materialexamples piece by piece and explains in depth what he is doing. Easily the best finance professor I have had. Exams are fair, if you take good notes and read the required chapters you will do well.
very good professor.  definitely the "fairest" instructor i have had thus far.  textbook not overly important

Funny, fair, and understandable. If you have the opportunity to take Finance 300 over the summer with this professor, do not hesitate. Keep up with reading but lecture notes and the practice exam will be your best friend.

He is such an awesome teacher. You will not regret having him. Very clear when he speaks and he is funny too! No HW, just three exams. As long as you really understand the notes from class, you will do well in his class.

Paker is one of UW's best. He presents concepts clearly and answers students' questions with no difficulty whatsoever. There wasn't a single lecture where I didn't laugh at least once, and that made the material a little less painful to learn. He's a great guy. The exams will definitely test you; don't take studying lightly at all.

Professor Paker is one of the best teachers the UW business school has to offer.  His intelligence, enthusiasm for teaching and his ability to communicate effectively to students all shine through during lectures.  Make sure to attend lecture as lecture notes are not posted online.
One of the best professors I've had at UW. Very helpful and explains things great. He's a funny and just overall a great guy. Take a class with him.

Extremely helpful professor! Very well taught and has a great finance background. I'm pretty sure I learned more finance in 3 weeks than I could have if I took it with someone else during the semester. If you can, TAKE THIS PROFESSOR!
Very organized. At the beginning of each class, he would state the objective of the day.
He's very clear and thorough.

Great professor, funny comments throughout semester.  Straight forward teaching style and helpfulness during OH kept me engaged.  I thought the exams were quite easy, at worst as difficult as the other finance courses

Does a great job teaching with thorough notes and examples and witty comments which make class bearable.  The material was more voring than I expected, but really easy.  Just do all the textbook problems and practice exams and you should be fine.  The curve was wider than comparable finance courses.

Great teacher and very interesting in class.  He didn't even use the textbook, but there were always review problems for each chapter he went over.  MY ONLY WARNING: His tests are REALLY hard (kind of reminded me of Physics), so make sure you do the practice exams and suggested problems or else you'll get a 50% like my friend.
Great professor, not too tough to get a B.  It's a real loss for UW allowing him to leave...

The undisputed best Professor at UW. He is an awesome person and if I could, I would love to have a beer with him. He changed my outlook and definitely solidified my decision to major in Finance. I can't wait to take 320 with him. I'll say it once more: HE IS THE BEST PROFESSOR in the SOB and probably the Best of the best at our univeristy.
Paker is an absolutely superb teacher.  He is with no doubt one of the best professors at the UW.
great lecture and a great man.  one of the best teachers Ive had.
He's a really good professor, I love him.

A true intellectual. Double Phd in Economics and Finance from the prestigious Univeristy of Wisconsin-Madison. All I have to say is that he is the best Professor I have ever encountered. I have abolsutely no complains but let me tell you, this class is not cake walk. He has an awesome accent, very funny, and down to earth. Respects students!

one of the very best professors ive ever had. he explains eveyrthing with numberous examples, makes jokes to keep you interested and awake, and is easy to understand, his accent may be the best part though, tests are very fair
Makes tons of hilarious comments in class--makes lecture interesting. Very good examples and explanations. Gives study guides to help with exams.

He is a great guy and very witty during class.  He tries to do what he can to make the boring classes easier to sit through.  Will take the time to help you.  If you don't fall behind you should easily get a B in his class.

Prof. Paker is a very nice person. He would be more than happy to help you during his office hours. Exams can be hard at times, but it is still reasonable. He curve your grades and more than half of the class is guaranteed a B. You need not go to discussions as they are a waste of time.
No Comments
Gret professor that takes the time to go over things in great detail. Exams were straigh-forward and overall experience was great.
